Sentencas: The carbon direct electrochemical reactions in a solid oxide electrolyte direct carbon fuel cell (DCFC) are investigated experimentally with CH4-deposited carbon at the anode as fuel.
Titulo: Mechanism for carbon direct electrochemical reactions in a solid oxide electrolyte direct carbon fuel cell

Sentencas: The surface morphology of the anode cross-sections is characterized using a scanning electron microscope (SEM), the elemental distribution using an energy dispersive spectrometer (EDS) and an X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), and the deposited carbon microstructures using a Raman spectrometer.
Titulo: Mechanism for carbon direct electrochemical reactions in a solid oxide electrolyte direct carbon fuel cell

Sentencas: The results indicate that all the carbon deposited on the yttrium-stabilized zirconium (YSZ) particle surfaces, the Ni particle surfaces, as well as the three-phase boundary, can participate in the electrochemical reactions during the fuel cell discharging.
Titulo: Mechanism for carbon direct electrochemical reactions in a solid oxide electrolyte direct carbon fuel cell

Sentencas: The direct electrochemical reactions for carbon require the two conditions that the O2- in the ionic conductor contact with a carbon reactive site and that the released electrons are conducted to the external circuit.
Titulo: Mechanism for carbon direct electrochemical reactions in a solid oxide electrolyte direct carbon fuel cell

Sentencas: The electrochemical reactions for the deposited carbon are most difficult on the Ni particle surfaces, easier on the YSZ particle surfaces and easiest at the three-phase boundary.
Titulo: Mechanism for carbon direct electrochemical reactions in a solid oxide electrolyte direct carbon fuel cell

Sentencas: Not all the carbon deposited in the anode participates in the direct electrochemical reactions.
Titulo: Mechanism for carbon direct electrochemical reactions in a solid oxide electrolyte direct carbon fuel cell

Sentencas: The deposited carbon and the O2- in the YSZ react to form the double-bonded adsorbed carbonyl group C = O. (C) 2010
Titulo: Mechanism for carbon direct electrochemical reactions in a solid oxide electrolyte direct carbon fuel cell
